title: Millie Bobby Brown blocks all toxic people out of her life
text:
Millie Bobby Brown revealed she blocks all toxic people from her life (Picture: Getty Images for Beach House Group)

Millie Bobby Brown may only be 15 years old, but it seems she’s more mature than most of us.

The Stranger Things star has been sharing her take on putting her own happiness first in life and, tbh, we could all really learn a thing or two.

Speaking to Seventeen, Millie explained how she has no time for negativity and how she’s become a dab hand at blocking out anything or anyone toxic from her life.

She revealed: ‘I block out all negativity in my life, so anyone or anything that’s getting in the way of me being happy will no longer be in my life.’

‘I think that toxic people – people that don’t just genuinely make you happy – you need to block out and, obvioulsy negativity on social media is not healthy,’ Millie said.

The teen star explained that by prioritising her own happiness, she’s been able to grow in self-confidence and self-love.

Millie, who has had us all obsessing over her new blonde hair ‘do recently, has not only been dishing out some worldly advice of late, but she’s been busy curating her very own skincare regime too.

While she might be known for her acting talent, she’s also taking on the beauty world with the launch of her new cruelty-free brand Florence by Mills.

Millie has spent two years crafting her skincare line that features a Clean Magic Face Wash, Glow Yeah Lip Oil, Zero Chill Mist Spray, Get That Grime Face Scrub, and Look Alive Eye Balm, as well as a few minimal-makeup items like brow gel and mascara.

Millie said prioritising her happiness has helped her grow in self-love and self-confidence (Picture: Instagram)

Although, Millie was recently forced to apologise for sharing a ‘fake’ skincare regime video online, as fans criticised her for not actually applying her face wash, as her make-up was still intact.

The post was quickly deleted, with Millie later issuing an apology for the misleading clip.

She wrote in a statement: ‘I’m still learning the best way to share my routines as I get to know this space better – I’m not an expert.

‘I thought doing a quick video replicating my personal process for that night was okay, but that’s not what was conveyed.

‘I understand, I appreciate all of your feedback on this journey, please keep sharing your thoughts and I will too! Ily guys x #loveandlight’.
